; Sat, 16 Sep 2023 12:25:03 +0800 施工方举报大桥偷工减料：事件逐渐“失焦”，情况属实还是造谣生事必须搞清楚丨快评http://www.infzm.com/contents/256667
;;2023-09-16 11:00:00;
;

;Recently, an accusation of "cutting corners on a highway bridge" has attracted attention. On August 30, 2023, a netizen surnamed Liu with the online name "Liu Shao" reported in real name on the social media platform that there were construction quality problems in the Qinghai Tongsai Expressway Taohe Bridge built by China Railway Fifth Engineering Bureau No. 5 Company.

;

;Liu claimed to be the actual construction party and began to undertake the substructure project of the Taohe Bridge on April 6, 2022, which lasted more than eight months. He reported that the project leader of China Railway No. 5 Bureau No. 5 Company "did not use steel bars from the shortlisted manufacturers according to the design, privately used non-standard steel bars from non-shortlisted manufacturers, cut corners during construction, and used unqualified sand and gravel materials during winter construction, resulting in poor concrete quality." qualified". Among them, statements such as "the pile inspection process changed the second-category piles to the first-category piles", "80% of the pile foundation steel bars are unqualified" and "there are hidden safety and quality risks" attracted the attention of the outside world.

;

;On the evening of September 6, the Fifth Company of China Railway No. 5 Bureau issued a public statement stating that it had previously entrusted Qinghai Provincial Traffic Inspection Co., Ltd. as a third-party testing agency to conduct quality inspections on the bridge. The inspection report shows that "the physical quality of the Taohe Bridge meets the design requirements and the quality is qualified." The steel bars and concrete used in the construction are all qualified, and the pile foundation tests are all Class I piles. Liu's reports have been refuted one by one. At present, the competent authority has entrusted a testing agency to "conduct physical quality inspection and raw material sampling inspection", and the re-inspection results will be announced to the public in a timely manner.

;

;Liu didn’t buy it. He showed evidence to "Running News" and said, "The test report I got contains Class II piles." The pouring time was May 26, 2022. The test date is June 29, 2022. Liu admitted that he made the report because the Fifth Company of China Railway No. 5 Bureau not only refused to pay him for his labor services, but instead cleared him from the site, causing heavy losses to him. “Now I have to report the project quality issues even if I don’t need any money.”

;

;According to media reports, Liu was sued by China Railway No. 5 Bureau No. 5 Company to the People's Court of Ledu District, Haidong City, Qinghai Province for infringing the company's reputation rights because he reported that his labor fees had not been settled. The case will be heard in court on September 18. Liu also presented evidence, saying that he had received a message from the other party "Look at the hardness of our China Railway No. 5 Bureau" after reporting with his real name; the other party also proposed a "compensation plan", but he did not agree if he was not satisfied. The Fifth Company of China Railway No. 5 Bureau responded that Liu’s main purpose was blackmail and “I will report it as soon as I don’t get the blackmail.”

;

;This incident has evolved to this point and has gradually become "out of focus": the dispute between Liu and China Railway has become a new hot spot. A closer look at this incident reveals that there are actually two important aspects that deserve further analysis and questioning.

;

;First, the relationship between the civil dispute between Liu and the Fifth Company of China Railway Fifth Engineering Bureau and his reporting behavior.

;

;Whether it is Liu's self-report or the "extortion of money" accusation from China Railway No. 5 Bureau, it is shown that the report was due to Liu's financial demands and that the two parties had a civil dispute. But what is curious is why the case was initiated by China Railway No. 5 Engineering Co., Ltd. against Liu for "infringement of reputation rights" instead of Liu launching a civil lawsuit against China Railway No. 5 Engineering Co., Ltd. due to a labor contract dispute?

;

;The cause of this incident was an economic dispute over "unpaid labor fees". Following this line of thought, Liu first reported the problem when he could not get the labor fee, but was sued for "infringement of reputation rights". Then, instead of filing a civil lawsuit on the grounds of a labor contract dispute and demanding payment of the labor fee, he filed an online lawsuit He reported that the project was cutting corners and materials, saying "I have to report project quality problems even if I don't get labor fees," and rejected China Railway's compensation plan. This shows that Liu escalated the incident at all costs, giving the outside world the impression that "the fish is dead and the net is broken."

;

;Looking at the evolution of the incident, there are still some questions hidden in the game between the two parties during this period: Has Liu's labor fee been settled? If it was indeed not settled, Liu initially went to China Railway Fifth Engineering Bureau and the relevant departments in Qinghai to report this problem. I am afraid it was just a normal rights protection. Why was he sued by the Fifth Company of China Railway Fifth Engineering Bureau for "infringement of the company's reputation rights"?

;

;In the chat records provided by Liu, the words of a person from the China Railway No. 5 Bureau after the real-name report, "The more you cause trouble, the less afraid I am. Look at the hardness of our China Railway No. 5 Bureau" to the outside world. It leaves more room for interpretation. This sentence can make people reasonably speculate that Liu chose to "turn the table" by exposing the quality problems of the project precisely because his demands for labor fees were repeatedly ignored by the other party. So, will the labor fees be settled on time, or will the compensation plan of China Railway No. 5 Bureau No. 5 Company satisfy Liu after the report, and the matter will be settled smoothly?

;

;If Liu came out to expose the project quality problems just because the labor fees were not paid, and the project quality problems were true, then the whole incident would have the flavor of "unevenly sharing the spoils, and turning the table over in anger". The problem behind it is undoubtedly more worrying; or, if the truth is as claimed by China Railway No. 5 Bureau No. 5 Company, Liu intends to "extort money", then whether the test results and the evidence he presented are forged, and how much his labor fees are? A clear answer should also be given as to why it was not settled and why it was not settled.

;

;Secondly, whether the truth of the incident is that Liu extorted money or that the Fifth Company of the China Railway Fifth Bureau was in arrears of labor fees, it cannot conceal the most important focus of this incident: whether the construction of the Taohe Bridge on the Tongsai Expressway was completed. Through safety inspection, whether there are any project quality problems.

;

;Public information shows that the Tongsai Expressway has a total length of 204 kilometers, and the total estimated investment of the project is 18.562 billion yuan. The main project will start on June 15, 2022, and is planned to be completed in October 2025. This expressway connects Qinghai Huangnan Tibetan Autonomous Prefecture and the Qinghai-Gansu border area. It is a section of the "G0611 Zhangwen Expressway". The Taohe Bridge is located in Saierlong Township, with a total length of 824.5 meters and a total of 20 spans. On July 17, 2023, the first box girder of the bridge was successfully erected.

;

;Liu Mou chose to report after the substructure project of the Taohe Bridge was completed and the first box girder was successfully erected. Judging from the current situation, it was because of the intensification of economic disputes. Which one is more convincing is the previous test results announced by the fifth company of China Railway Fifth Engineering Bureau, the test results of the supervision company commissioned by Liu himself, and the evidence presented. This is something that the competent authorities should conduct an in-depth and serious investigation in the follow-up.

;

;In fact, inconsistencies between actual construction and prior surveys are relatively common in the engineering community. If Liu's accusation is true and China Railway No. 5 Bureau No. 5 Company chooses "non-standard steel bars, unqualified sand and gravel materials and Class II piles" in construction, its impact on the quality of the project will also need to be determined through professional evaluation. The key to the problem is whether changing construction materials will affect the quality of the project and thus endanger the safety of the Taohe Bridge.

;

;In short, the focus of this matter should not be on the dispute between Liu and China Railway No. 5 Bureau. Relevant departments should adhere to the principle of safety first in the follow-up investigation, focus on the inspection of project quality, investigate whether the fifth company of China Railway No. 5 Bureau made normal changes in construction materials or cut corners, and fully demonstrate the impact of changes in construction materials on the traffic of the Taohe Bridge. impact on safety and fully disclose the findings to the public. If there is indeed a case of cutting corners and affecting the quality of the bridge, the relevant responsible persons should be severely dealt with and even held criminally responsible; if the whistleblower spreads rumors and causes trouble, he cannot go unpunished.

;

;;The current development of network technology is rapid, and new things such as 5G, Metaverse, ChatGPT and so on are emerging. It makes people exclaim "the future is already here". And along with it, there are also a large number of hidden network security risks. ;

;

;;As a specialized agency for safeguarding national security and a department in charge of counter-espionage work, national security agencies continue to strengthen the tracking, monitoring and prevention of relevant activities, effectively safeguard our network security, and make " "Digital" spies reveal their true colors and have nowhere to hide! ;

;

;;;Where did the attack come from? ;;;;Spy shadows thousands of miles away;;

;

;;Currently, cyberspace has become a target for overseas espionage and intelligence agencies. An important position for my country to carry out cyber espionage work, our country has become the main victim of high-level persistent threat (APT) attacks. In recent years, national security agencies have discovered that dozens of espionage and intelligence agencies from different countries and regions have carried out cyber attacks in our territory. They either set up specialized agencies, set up "cover companies", and developed professional means to directly carry out cyberattacks and penetrations against me, or through "behind-the-scenes control" and "service outsourcing" methods, they instruct professional companies and hacker organizations to carry out the operations, or through "purchasing" "Data, loopholes, tools and other methods are used to lure domestic institutions and personnel to implement it. Some countries also use the guise of "hunting" to lure other countries to implement it. ;

;

;;;Who are the potential targets? ;;;;The flash of swords and shadows within easy reach;;

;

;;From the perspective of attack targets, in addition to the continued attacks on our national institutions and related In addition to carrying out cyber attacks on "traditional targets" such as confidential units, overseas espionage and intelligence agencies have also continued to strengthen attacks and penetrations on China's critical information infrastructure and major infrastructure network systems, and have further extended their black hands to China's universities, scientific research institutions, and large-scale infrastructure. Enterprises, high-tech companies and other institutions and business executives, experts and scholars and other groups. ;

;

;;Judging from the attacks, various software systems such as email, office automation, user management, and security protection are involved, as well as various hardware devices such as servers, computers, switches, and routers. , as well as mobile phones, WIFI, cameras and other civilian household equipment, it can be said to be "pervasive". ;

;

;;;What are the tricks? ;;;;A highly threatening "professional team" ;;

;

;;Different from ordinary social hackers, overseas espionage and intelligence agencies It has many resources to mobilize, strong technical capabilities, rich experience in cyber attack activities, and more covert methods. ;

;

;;Some of them collect and steal personal information, use social engineering, and accurately forge “phishing” emails and websites to conduct deception attacks on target objects; some use mining and purchasing key "Zero-day vulnerabilities" in software systems and hardware equipment directly attack and penetrate the company; some first intrude into the network of companies that control our supply chain or operation and maintenance service organizations, and then use this as a "springboard" to attack downstream user units; some on a large scale Penetrate and control China's civilian network and home network equipment, and establish "positions" to carry out cyber attacks against China and other countries. Behind extremely professional and covert attack methods, there are often more dangerous intentions! ;

;

;;

;

;;Overseas cyber attacks against us;;Common;;Common techniques< /span>;

;

;;;How much harm is caused? ;;;;Security issues that cannot be underestimated;;

;

;;Cyberattacks by overseas espionage and intelligence agencies are large-scale and deep-seated , strong sustainability. Once the network systems of our country's state agencies, secret-related units and other important corporate institutions are attacked or invaded, the state secrets, important data, documents, etc. stored and processed may be "caught in one sweep." Once our critical information infrastructure and major infrastructure network systems are invaded and controlled, they will face the risk of being disrupted and destroyed at any time. Overseas spy agencies conduct cyber attacks to steal trade secrets and intellectual property rights of our companies and institutions, and monitor the content of our citizens’ network communications for a long time. They also seriously infringe upon the legitimate rights and interests of our citizens and organizations. ;

;

;;

;

;;Environment;;Reduction of cyber attack and secret theft scenarios of foreign spy and intelligence agencies;;

; Sat, 16 Sep 2023 10:25:03 +0800 吼书、盲书、射书、乱书，哪种是真正的书法？http://www.infzm.com/contents/256848
;;2023-09-16 09:00:00;
;

;Wang Dongling has a notebook with "dirty material". The notebook is filled with comments from netizens who "spite" him, such as "Wang Dongling is a braggart" and "Wang Dongling has gone crazy..." Wang Dongling opened the notebook, which contained both serious critical articles and vulgar abuse. "When a compilation of information about me is printed in the future, all of this can be printed." Wang Dongling said with a smile.

;

;;

;

;In November 2016, Wang Dongling's calligraphy art solo exhibition opened at the Taimiao Art Museum in Beijing, and he was swiping at the scene. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Wang Dongling is a calligrapher, but he is also happy to be called a calligrapher. modern artist. Rather than being praised by his peers, the "chaotic books" he created gained more from the incomprehension of ordinary audiences. Wang Dongling's "chaotic calligraphy" is not the first to be criticized for modern calligraphy, and it will certainly not be the last. In recent years, netizens have criticized Zeng Xiang's "Roaring Book", Zhang Qiang's "Blind Book" and Shao Yan's "Shooting Book"... As the name suggests, when creating "Roaring Book", Zeng Xiang was drunk. He seemed to be mad, roaring and yelling; when Zhang Qiang wrote, he didn't look at the brush and the writing object, and applied it by hand; Shao Yan filled the ink with a needle and sprayed the words on the rice paper, which can be said to follow the shape of the object... Popular opinion Not understanding these various new "calligraphy", some people simply call them "ugly calligraphy". In the newly released movie "The Story of Yong'an Town", the director who is good at ridicule pokes fun at the film industry, but also satirizes the "Master of Shouting Books".

;

;Compared with them, Wang Dongling still looks like traditional calligraphy at least in the "movements" of his creation - but people still can't see clearly what he wrote in his "random calligraphy". When I open a piece of Wang Dongling's "chaos calligraphy" work, I can see intersecting lines, like dead branches on the ground, and like swords fighting in chaos, but not a single clear and independent Chinese character can be seen.

;

;;

;

;Wang Dongling's "Li Bai Poetic" calligraphy installation was exhibited at the China Academy of Art Museum's "Calligraphy·Not Calligraphy - 2019 International Modern Calligraphy Art Festival". ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;At a social inscription scene, Wang Dongling asked the organizer with a sly smile, "Do you want me to Should you write more messily or be more disciplined?" The words to be inscribed were "Art for a better life". The organizer nodded Weiwei and said, "Be more disciplined, be more disciplined." Wang Dongling picked up the brush and thought for a moment. Several big words had already fallen on it. on paper. Looking carefully, the strokes of these characters are indeed much more "regular", with adhesion but little overlap. "My characters are not very intertwined, but there is still some expressiveness in them." Wang Dongling told Southern Weekend the reporter said.

;

;Like Wang Dongling, Zeng Xiang, Shao Yan and Zhang Qiang can also write very "proper" characters. When the public laughs at them, few people ask why they give up "proper" writing. Calligraphy, doing these things that look like performance art?

;

;;

;

;Not all of Wang Dongling's works are in the form of "chaotic calligraphy". The picture shows his works on display at the Zhejiang Art Museum in 2021. ;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;"Everyone has the desire to criticize and explain. I am now a target to let people have this desire. It looks good to me," Wang Dongling said. Nearly eighty years old, he seems to be in a good mood. He said that when he was young, he could not hear scolding, which would make him feel uncomfortable, but now he has become "early", and he would sometimes laugh out loud when looking through the notebook with "dirty information".

;

;Breaking the "Word Barrier"

;

;Wang Dongling has a thin figure, with dry white hair and messy hair. Sometimes she speaks in a breathless voice, and you have to get closer to hear it clearly. It was startling. If his voice is compared to a calligraphy work, then his layout is what Deng Shiru said: "It can be sparse but airtight."

;

;;

;

;Wang Dongling once presented Chinese cultural classics in the form of "chaotic scripts" and "wall scripts". The picture shows the large-scale mirror wall book "I Ching" he exhibited in 2016. It is written on a stainless steel plate with white paint and is 32 meters long and 3.5 meters high. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;The first impression given by "Chaoshu" is its white cloth and unique composition. "Zhangfa" and "Bubai" are calligraphy terms, which refer to the arrangement, layout and mutual response between words and lines during the entire writing process. In traditional calligraphy works, the line spacing is roughly clear, and the strokes cannot cross between words. Even the continuous grass of the late Ming Dynasty will still generally abide by such rules. "Look at Xu Wei's "Ying Zhi Ying Sword", there are a few places where the strokes touch and cross, but it is not obvious." Wang Dongling zoomed in on Xu Wei's work on her mobile phone and kept zooming in until the complete picture could no longer be seen. Glyphs and dancing lines fill the entire phone screen.

;

;When he was a child, Wang Dongling observed an old tree in front of his teacher’s house, and the zigzag lines were imprinted in his memory. Later, he also looked at the trees in the American wilderness and found that the lines created by the vitality of the trees were different, but intersected harmoniously.

;

;Every winter, he goes to see the dead lotuses on the West Lake. He has more than 20,000 photos of dead lotuses on his computer. Look at the dead lotus stems, all scattered and scattered, seemingly chaotic, but there is an underlying order in the chaos. When the ideographic nature of Chinese characters is completely covered up - like the enlarged Xu Wei that makes it difficult to see what character it is, then only the lines of the Chinese characters are left in front of the viewer's eyes.

;

;In the history of calligraphy, the "overlapping" of characters can be traced back to Yan Zhenqing's "Seat Struggle", but that may be unconscious. When it came to Xu Wei, "I think his calligraphy was intended to break the line spacing," Wang Dongling said. Later, Zheng Banqiao's calligraphy was called "paving the streets with random stones." "In fact, they all wanted to break the calligraphy and line spacing." "

;

;"Chaoshu" is to push this "break" to the extreme. If you look at Wang Dongling's random writing process, every word he writes is actually in accordance with cursive writing (cursive, a calligraphy term, refers to the cursive writing rules of Chinese characters. The cursive writing of each character is roughly fixed and conventional). "It's nothing more than an overlap."

;

;When words overlap and strokes intertwine, the viewer cannot clearly see what is written. Therefore, the "word barrier" for Chinese people to read calligraphy is broken, and they can concentrate on feeling the lines. flow.

;

;;

;

;In 2021, the 60-year exhibition of Wang Dongling's calligraphy art was held at Zhejiang Art Museum. The picture shows an audience staying in front of Wang Dongling's works. ;(Visual China/Picture);

;

;For Chinese people, when they look at a piece of calligraphy, they first of course want to understand what it says. , in Wang Dongling's opinion, is a "writing barrier", which keeps many ordinary people away from the deeper beauty of calligraphy. Just like someone listens to his mother tongue and understands the meaning, but unconsciously ignores the beauty of the pronunciation. Only people who do not understand the language at all will notice the high and low pitch values ​​and the gentleness of the timbre when listening. .

;

;"Calligraphy has developed over thousands of years. Traditional calligraphy has been very perfect and mature. It is difficult for you to break through at all." Wang Dongling said that calligraphy has two attributes, one is cultural attribute, and the other is cultural attribute. It is Chinese characters written by Chinese people, so we naturally want to understand it, "There is nothing wrong with this", but another attribute of calligraphy is its artistic attribute. If you admit that it is an art, then it must Have personality and express the creator.”

;

;“Chaotic script is the extension of ancient cursive script.” This is Wang Dongling’s own understanding of chaotic script. He puts his creation into the track of the ancients, “Of course my heart is not as wild as Xu Wei’s. , but you must have passion to write cursive."

;

; Can people who understand music learn calligraphy faster?

;

;Walking into Wang Dongling’s studio, the floor is covered with all kinds of manuscript papers, rice paper, and albums. It can be said to be a “street full of paper.” This studio has received many foreigners who admired Chinese calligraphy. "Professor Wang Dongling gave me my first calligraphy lesson." In 2015, Apple CEO Tim Cook said on Weibo. At that time, Cook visited Wang Dongling's studio, and Wang Dongling taught him to use Apple pencil to write the word "goodbye" with calligraphy strokes on the iPad. Prior to this, he was invited to Apple headquarters in California to provide professional calligraphy advice on the iPad’s writing capabilities.

;

;For Apple, this Weibo undoubtedly has a strong marketing temperament, but Wang Dongling does not reject invitations from other cultures.

;

;In March 1989, Wang Dongling went to give lectures at the University of Minnesota in the United States. What he brought with him was a large pen and the "Longzang Temple Stele" which he copied repeatedly. Wang Dongling still remembers the winter in Minnesota, when there was heavy snow outside the window, and his car was stuck deep in the snow, like an ink mark in the snow.

;

;Wang Dongling’s English is very poor. In his own words, when he first arrived in the United States, he didn’t know all 26 letters. So far, I may only recognize 200 words. But he is very willing to exchange calligraphy with foreigners. In 1981, Wang Dongling received a master's degree in calligraphy from Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts (now China Academy of Art) and stayed at the school to teach. At that time, Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts was the only school in the country that majored in calligraphy, so the Ministry of Culture sent all international students studying calligraphy to Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts. From then on, Wang Dongling took on the task of teaching calligraphy to international students.

;

;Even now, many people still feel that it is impossible to teach Westerners to learn calligraphy. They do not understand ancient Chinese, and learning Chinese characters does not happen overnight. But Wang Dongling's teaching practice told him that this does not seem to be the case. "They often make mistakes in stroke order and structure, and even write wrong words. But this is not a problem." In Wang Dongling's view, foreigners have overcome the "writing barrier" from the beginning.

;

;British art historian Gombrich once concluded that the role of calligraphy in Chinese culture corresponds well with music in European culture. Wang Dongling's experience tells him that students who have previous musical accomplishments will learn faster. "The form of cursive calligraphy art is a division of space by overflowing tension and irregular lines. This kind of space displayed after black and white treatment is full of changes in virtual reality and rhythm, and it is a musical space." Wang Dongling said .

;

;The Internet celebrity "Teacher Andy" of Bilibili, who is now over seventy years old, has been working tirelessly to popularize Western classical music to the public on the Chinese Internet in recent years. His full name is Andreas Stier. German, he is a piano professor at the Hamburg State University of Music. He was once a student of Wang Dongling. Wang Dongling still remembers that in the 1980s, he took Andy Shi and several other international students to the home of Mr. Lu Yanshao. Mr. Lu Yanshao read the works of several foreign students in turn and saw the "Silence" in the "Taishan Diamond Sutra" written by Andy Shi. "Chinese people have not been able to write at this level for a long time."

;

;In 1990, Wang Dongling was in the United States, watching various contemporary art and contemporary dances. Once, he watched an artistic performance by American middle school students. There were solo dances and group dances of three people. The children were twisting their bodies unscrupulously. "Their body language made me feel that no matter how innovative Chinese calligraphy is, it should be allowed," he said. "Wang Dongling said that graffiti, like dancing, is one of human instincts. "The writing of Chinese characters has a strong graffiti nature. Calligraphy is a spiritual artistic product that combines human instincts with Chinese characters." And in Kuangcao. In "Kang Cao", human instincts are released as much as possible. "Kang Cao is greatly weakened from the constraints of ranks, providing a free world for the author to express space. In Kuang Cao, the writing, rhythm and rhythm of calligraphy are brought into full play." ”

;

;Traditional calligraphy, Jianghu style, modern calligraphy

;

;Although Wang Dongling looks thin, in the face of the physically demanding calligraphy, he can write the large-scale "Thousand-Character Essay" 》. It took four hours to write a random piece of "The Thousand Character Essay". In Wang Dongling's own words, it was indeed improvised writing, but it was not a "disordered accident, but a kind of muscle memory after years of training." And when writing, you should always pay attention to the connection between words and the overall layout.

;

;Qi Gong once said, "Layout is very difficult." Layout has also become one of the criteria that distinguishes professional calligraphers from calligraphy enthusiasts generally known as "Jianghu style".

;

;In Wang Dongling's opinion, the current people who study calligraphy can be roughly divided into three types of people. One type is those who follow the traditional path, conscientiously write posts and monuments, and write "good-looking" characters according to traditional standards. This type of people is the cornerstone of calligraphy. The second category is the "jianghu style". "With the participation of all people now, there must be some people who are not good at basic skills but are eager for quick success and quick success. They attract people's attention but have no level. These people can be called 'jianghu style'."< /p>;

;There are also some people who want calligraphy to become a breakthrough modern art. Not only are there people like Wang Dongling who are making breakthroughs within calligraphy, but there are also people who are combining calligraphy with contemporary art such as installation, performance, and video. Some of the "ugly books" considered by the public come from the Jianghu style, and a large number of them come from this group. Wang Dongling also makes no secret that he belongs to the third category. Although his daily training is the same as that of traditional calligraphers, he also has to write calligraphy every day. "In the final analysis, modern calligraphy is to express people's emotions. I am a firm supporter of modern calligraphy and Promoter".

;

;Few people know that the establishment of the first calligraphy major in China actually came from the influence of modern calligraphy. After World War II, Japan regarded calligraphy as an art, engaged in modern calligraphy and avant-garde calligraphy, and attached great importance to the popularization of calligraphy education. In the early 1960s, Pan Tianshou went to Japan to study calligraphy and was deeply moved. He returned to Hangzhou and founded China's first calligraphy and seal cutting major at the Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts with Sha Menghai, Lu Weizhao and others.

;

;In 1979, Zhejiang Academy of Fine Arts was commissioned by the Ministry of Culture to recruit the first master's degree students in calligraphy in the country. Wang Dongling became a student of Sha Menghai, Lu Weizhao and other gentlemen, and was one of the first five masters of calligraphy in New China. In the autumn of 1980, Wang Dongling accompanied Mr. Sha Menghai to Beijing to see the original stone drum exhibition at the Palace Museum. I have read Han Yu's "Song of the Stone Drum", seen the original rubbings of "The Inscriptions on the Stone Drum", and read Wu Changshuo's "The Inscription on the Stone Drum", but when I saw the original copy of the Stone Drum, "Even if I don't look at the specific words, the kind of text that the Stone Drum carries The atmosphere of ancient times makes people deeply moved. This experience is the same as looking at the statue in front of Huo Qubing's tomb, which is very wonderful." In Wang Dongling's own memories, this trip to Beijing brought a great shock to his artistic concept. "I feel that the highest state of calligraphy is far from the stability and exquisiteness of pointillism. What is more important is that lines can carry abundant vitality and inexhaustible vitality."

;

;In the 1990s, Wang Dongling After returning to the United States, he began to devote himself to promoting and practicing modern calligraphy. Since then, he has been subjected to pressure and ridicule from all walks of life. At first, there were doubts from the professional calligraphy community. In recent years, the situation has reversed. The professional calligraphy community has turned to a positive evaluation of him, but the public in the Internet age has made an even harsher voice.

;

;Wang Dongling has some intuitive self-explanations to explain the creation process of chaos books to the public, such as Huai Su watching the peaks of summer with many strange clouds, Zhang Xu watching Gongsun Auntie dancing with a sword, Huang Tingjian watching the boatmen rowing, all enlightened He developed new calligraphy skills, and connected his random calligraphy with the residual lotus. When asked if this was an afterthought, he smiled and said, "the two grew out of each other."

;

;Like Zeng Xiang, the "master of shouting", he likes to write big characters. When he writes, there are many onlookers - but Wang Dongling basically doesn't shout. When writing calligraphy, people are watching and cheering. This is also a tradition. When Zhang Xu writes cursive script, people often watch him. Jin Shengtan listed thirty-three joyful things in life, one of which is "How wonderful it is to watch people write big books in a nest!" He also hopes that people can enjoy calligraphy with the mood of "It is wonderful".

;

;Wang Dongling supports the innovation of calligraphy as a modern art, but he seems quite hesitant about one question. A reporter from Southern Weekend asked him: "Will the innovations of some young people with weak basic skills be successful?" Will it be superficial? But if young people follow the tradition and practice to the state of "old people and books" as the ancients said, and then make innovations and breakthroughs, have they missed the best time in their lives? Is there any hidden meaning in this? Contradiction?" For a person who is still enthusiastic about creation when he is nearly eighty years old, this may not be a problem. ;;2023-09-15 23:00:00;
;

;;

;

;; (Visual China/Picture) ;

;

;The "Book of Mountains and Seas·Beishan Jing" describes: "On Panhou's Mountain... there is a beast, which looks like an ox and has hair on all four joints. It is called an ox." In ancient times, In Tibetan mythology, wild yaks are called "stars" in the sky, and white yaks are especially revered.

;

;Putting aside the veil of mystery, where did the white yak come from in reality?

;

;Both the black yak and the white yak are domesticated by humans from wild yaks. The wild yak is a first-level protected animal in China. Archaeologists have discovered bison and other ungulate fossils in the middle and late Pleistocene strata of the Quaternary about 3 million years ago. Wild yaks were once widely distributed in China. They can be seen everywhere in the Himalayas, Kunlun Mountains and Qinghai-Tibet Plateau. Nowadays, with human development, the distribution area of ​​wild yaks has rapidly shrunk and fragmented. They can only be found in the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau, mainly living in the Qiangtang National Nature Reserve in Tibet.

;

;Domestic yaks were domesticated from wild yaks. From the past to the present, people have used molecular genetics knowledge, sequencing technology and other biological information methods to extract information from many species by combining morphological similarities with archaeological discoveries. This aspect reveals evidence of wild yak domestication. Professor Liu Jianquan from the School of Ecology of Lanzhou University constructed a complete yak genome structure variation map by studying the genome structure of 23 individuals of domestic yaks and wild yaks. He found that domestic yaks living in the alpine pastoral areas of the Qinghai-Tibet Plateau at an altitude of 2,000-5,000 meters are descended from humans. It was domesticated 7,300 years ago from the wild yak that currently lives in the uninhabited area of ​​the northern plateau.与此同时，在家牦牛和野牦牛之间高度分化的结构变异，即在驯化中受到人工选择的结构变异，受选择结构变异影响的基因与神经系统发育、行为等驯化性状以及生殖能力、免疫能力等经济性状相关的功能有关，为了解牦牛驯化的遗传学机制提供了新的视角。

;

;国家畜禽资源委员会2019年的最新调查结果显示，家牦牛包括17个地方品种与2个培育品种，分布在甘肃、青海、新疆、云南、西藏与四川地区，受各地区地理条件的影响，这些牦牛品种在长期的演化中也形成了鲜明的地方特色。这些不同的家牦牛最受科学上困扰的是毛色之谜，尤其是何时何地产生了白牦牛，花牦牛是白牦牛与黑牦牛之间杂交的结果还是和其他牛的杂交产物？

;

;随后，刘建全团队与中国农科院兰州牧药所阎萍研究员等课题组合作，通过近30年的野外采样，完成了家养牦牛所有品种的采样和二十余头野牦牛的采样，并能成功提取出完整的DNA，供基因组分析，由此构建了牛属物种的基因组图。研究发现，家牦牛经过驯化后，又与另一种牛进行过杂交，接近90%的家牦牛拥有来自黄牛的基因组结构变异，占其所有基因组结构变异的约1%-5%。黄牛驯化自近东和印度河流域的野牛，由人类带到青藏高原的时间不会超过4000年。相关研究成果《Evolutionary origin of genomic structural variations in domestic yaks》于近日发表在国际学术期刊《Nature Communications》上。

;

;而正是来自黄牛的遗传渗入导致了家牦牛不同品种表型变异的关键遗传基础。通俗讲就是在大概两千年的时间内，家牦牛和花黄牛在放牧过程中由于主动或被动的种间杂交产生了花牦牛，而花牦牛再经过遗传变异产生了白牦牛。由此解开了困扰科学界的“白牦牛”的身世之谜。除了揭开科学上的谜团，这项研究对于牦牛品种的改良提供了一个新的视角。

;

;由于牦牛封闭的养殖环境且畜种间交流较少，同时受全球气候变化以及过度放牧对天然草场的破坏的影响导致牦牛生存环境的恶化，各牦牛品种均出现了不同程度的退化。因此，对家牦牛进行杂交改良与品种选育成为了一项重要工作。家牦牛与野牦牛在外貌特征、繁殖方式、生产性能以及抗病力上虽有不同程度的差异，但大体上较为相似，最大的不同就是野牦牛的抗病力明显好于家牦牛。呼吸系统疾病、寄生虫病以及巴氏杆菌病等一些传染病是家牦牛常见的一些疾病，野牦牛体格健壮、抗逆性好，利用野牦牛培育出的杂交一代牦牛体重等各项指标与当地同龄家牦牛相比均明显增强。现有研究发现有野牦牛分布地区的家牦牛体格和产肉量明显优于没有野牦牛分布地区的家牦牛。

;

;牦牛是青藏高原不可或缺的牛种，未来在牦牛产业的发展方面，应致力于家牦牛的品种改良与培育，以科研为技术支撑深度挖掘野牦牛的遗传资源优势，大力提高家牦牛的生产性能，以带来更大的经济效益。正如刘建全教授所言：“在基因编辑和转基因时代，种间杂交仍应作为培育适应气候变化和人类需求新品种，甚至新物种的重要手段，但思路和技术要革新。”

;飓风“丹尼尔”9月10日在利比亚东部地中海沿岸登陆并引发洪水，在德尔纳、贝达、舍哈特等地造成大量人员伤亡。利比亚红新月会14日说，飓风及其引发的洪灾在德尔纳市已造成逾1.1万人丧生，另有1万余人失踪。

;

;利比亚红新月会说，截至14日，受灾严重的德尔纳市在这场灾害中的遇难人数已达11300人，另有10100人失踪。德尔纳市市长估计，基于受损情况看，最终遇难人数可能远高于宣布数字，“达到1.8万至2万人”。

;

;;

;

;这是9月11日在利比亚东部城市德尔纳拍摄的洪水过后的景象。新华社发（利比亚国民代表大会任命的政府供图）

;

;由于道路和桥梁被毁，电力和通信中断，通往德尔纳的道路仍然严重受阻。

;

;“几秒钟内，水位突然上涨。”法新社援引一名受伤幸存者的话报道，他和母亲被洪水卷走，二人随后设法爬进一栋无人建筑。

;

;“这场灾难凶猛惨烈，”红十字国际委员会驻利比亚代表说，“7米高的巨浪摧毁了建筑物，将基础设施冲入大海。”

;

;;

;

;这是9月11日在利比亚东部城市德尔纳拍摄的洪水过后的景象。新华社发（利比亚国民代表大会任命的政府供图）

;

;联合国分管人道主义事务的副秘书长马丁·格里菲思表示，这场灾难的规模令人震惊。“数千人死亡，数以万计人无家可归，还有更多人下落不明。”

;

;据报道，埃及、突尼斯、阿拉伯联合酋长国、土耳其、卡塔尔等国救援队已抵达利比亚，协助当地政府救灾。陆续有其他国家也加入援助行动或承诺提供援助。利比亚洪灾的全球援助行动正在加速。

;

;;

;

;9月13日，工作人员在约旦安曼一军用机场搬运送往利比亚的援助物资。新华社发（穆罕默德·阿布·古什摄）

;

;气候学家认为，这场灾难与全球变暖以及利比亚基础设施老旧落后有关。

;

;2011年，美国等西方国家武装干涉利比亚，支持反对派推翻穆阿迈尔·卡扎菲政权。利比亚此后政局动荡。由于连年战乱，德尔纳市没有统一的中央政府管理，基础设施老旧，防洪抗洪能力较弱。事发时，当地既没有洪水预警系统，也没有疏散应急预案。

;;

;

;The issue of "darkness under the lights" has become the focus of disciplinary inspection and supervision agencies at all levels. ;(Interface News/Photo);

;

;On September 15, 2023, the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection once again reported information about the investigation of an "insider" , this is the sixth list of disciplinary inspection and supervision cadres suspected of serious violations of discipline and law notified by the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection within a month.

;

;The latest "insider" reported is Liu Lixian, former Party Committee member and Secretary of the Discipline Inspection Commission of the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China, who voluntarily surrendered. Public information shows that Liu Lixian was born in 1954. He served as deputy director of the Corruption and Bribery Prosecution Department of the Supreme People's Procuratorate, deputy director of the General Administration of Anti-Corruption and Bribery, director of the Procuratorial Technology Bureau, and director of the Procuratorial Theory Research Institute.

;

;In 2005, Liu Lixian officially joined the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China and served as Secretary of the Discipline Inspection Commission of the Industrial and Commercial Bank of China in October of that year. After that, Liu Lixian was appointed as the deputy leader of the 11th Central Inspection Team in June 2013, and worked successively in the State Sports General Administration, China Guodian Group Corporation, China First Heavy Machinery Group Corporation, Harbin Electric Group Corporation and other units. Inspections were conducted.

;

;This week, in addition to Liu Lixian, the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection also reported information on four "insiders" on September 11.

;

;Xiang Yuewen, member of the Standing Committee of the Bengbu Municipal Party Committee and Secretary of the Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection in Anhui Province, is one of them. His resume shows that Xiang Yuewen, who was born in 1973, has worked in Anhui for a long time and has served as Secretary of the Shucheng County Committee of the Communist Youth League, Secretary of the Lu'an Municipal Committee of the Communist Youth League, and Magistrate of Huoshan County.

;

;Before the release of this notice, on July 19, Xiang Yuewen’s name also appeared in an article on the WeChat public account of Anhui Discipline Inspection and Supervision. The article mentioned that he attended the Second Inspection Team of the Anhui Provincial Party Committee A work mobilization meeting was held to inspect Yuhui District and Huaishang District of Bengbu City, and specific requirements were put forward for cooperation in the inspection work.

;

;Zhou Ming, former deputy director of the Office of the Inspection Leading Group of the Shaanxi Provincial Committee and first-level inspector, Li Ren, leader of the Discipline Inspection and Supervision Team of the Sichuan Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection at Chengdu Institute of Technology, and former Standing Committee Member of the Jiangning District Committee of Nanjing City Yang Bin, the former secretary of the District Commission for Discipline Inspection, was also announced as a "ghost" together with Xiang Yuewen.

;

;Zhou Ming has worked for the Shaanxi Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection for a long time. In 2012, he attended the anti-corruption work conference in universities as the director of the Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection.

;

;Yang Bin, who was born in Zhenjiang, Jiangsu, has worked in the disciplinary inspection and supervision system for a long time. His resume shows that since his employment, Yang Bin has served as deputy division-level discipline inspection and supervisor of the Discipline Inspection Commission of Nanjing Yanjiang Industrial Development Zone, deputy division-level discipline inspection and supervisor of the Second Office of Discipline Inspection and Supervision of the Nanjing Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection, director of the third office, secretary of the Discipline Inspection Commission of Nanjing Jiangning District, and district supervisor. Director of the Supervisory Committee, leader of the Nanjing Municipal Party Committee Inspection Team, etc. In January 2022, Yang Bin was transferred to deputy secretary of the Party Leadership Group and deputy prosecutor general of the Nanjing Municipal People's Procuratorate.

;

;Li Ren, who holds a doctorate in law, is a cadre who came out of school and has only served in the disciplinary inspection system for a short time. After graduating from the Mathematics Department of Aba Teachers College in 1986, Li Ren stayed at the school and worked as deputy secretary of the Aba Teachers College Committee of the Communist Youth League. He later served as secretary of the Aba Teachers College Committee of the Communist Youth League, director of the Organization Department of the Party School of the Sichuan Provincial Committee, and assistant researcher. After 2005, Li Ren successively served as the director of the Audit Bureau of Suining City, secretary of the Shehong County Party Committee, and deputy mayor of Suining City. Until December 2019, he was transferred to the leader of the Discipline Inspection and Supervision Team of the Sichuan Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection in Chengdu Institute of Technology.

;

;Looking back, in the past month, on August 23, August 25, August 29, and August 31, the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection reported 15 people under investigation four times. News about the "ghost".

;

;On August 23, the largest number of people were notified, reaching 6 people. They were Jia Muquan, leader of the Discipline Inspection and Supervision Team of the Shanxi Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection in the Provincial Department of Civil Affairs, member of the Party Leadership Group of the Provincial Department of Civil Affairs, and the Second Inspection Inspector of the Guangdong Provincial Committee. Team leader Su Quangui, former deputy team leader of the Hainan Provincial Party Committee inspection team Wu Jie, former member of the Standing Committee of the Changzhou Municipal Party Committee and former secretary of the Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection Shen Bin, former secretary of the Xuchang Municipal Commission for Discipline Inspection and former director of the Municipal Supervision Commission Luo Jun, Hebei Province Geology and Mineral Exploration and Development Congratulations to the former first-level inspector of the bureau.

;

;Wang Weiping, the former leader of the Discipline Inspection Team of the Henan Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection in the Provincial Public Security Department, was notified separately on August 25. In addition to the above-mentioned personnel, Han Taiguang, the former leader of the Hainan Provincial Party Committee’s inspection team, Yue Dechuan, the former leader of the 13th Inspection Team of the Shandong Provincial Party Committee, a former member of the party group of the Guizhou Provincial Department of Culture and Tourism, and the Discipline Inspection and Supervision Team assigned by the Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection to the Provincial Department of Culture and Tourism Former team leader Jiang Zhilun, leader of Inspection Group Three of the Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region Party Committee Wang Liangshan, former deputy department-level discipline inspection inspector of Hubei Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection Ai Shaobin, Secretary of the Discipline Inspection Commission and Supervision Commissioner of Jilin Provincial Water Investment Group Co., Ltd. Liu Xiangyu, Secretary of the Party Leadership Group of Harbin Red Cross Society , Executive Vice Chairman Liu Zhi, and Chen Gang, former member of the Party Committee of the Guizhou Provincial Public Security Department and former leader (department level) of the Discipline Inspection and Supervision Team assigned by the Provincial Commission for Discipline Inspection to the Provincial Public Security Department, are also among the "ghosts".

;

;Since 2023, the issue of "darkness under the lights" has become the focus of disciplinary inspection and supervision agencies at all levels. On September 9, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the National Supervisory Commission issued a document stating that inspection and rectification should pay more attention to facing the problems head-on and being strict to the end. We should use hard work to identify problems, self-examination and self-correction, and clean up the door, resolutely eliminate the bad apples, and prevent "lightning". "Under the black".

;

;On July 24, the website of the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection published the "Supervision, Inspection and Investigation of Discipline Inspection and Supervision Cadres in the First Half of 2023". The data shows that in the first six months of 2023, the national discipline inspection and supervision system received a total of More than 20,200 cases of clues and reports on issues involving disciplinary inspection and supervision cadres were handled, and more than 18,700 cases of clues on issues involving disciplinary inspection and supervision cadres were handled. 6,647 disciplinary inspection and supervision cadres were interviewed by letters of communication, 2,482 cases were filed, 1,647 people were punished, and 73 people were transferred to judicial organs. Among them, there are 54 cadres at the department and bureau level, and 123 people have been put on record for serious violations of disciplines and laws. Southern Weekend reporters noticed that the above data have almost doubled compared with the same period in 2022.

;

;;Personnel Trends ;

;

;;【 Ministry of Justice, Ministry of Science and Technology , Ministry of Public Security leadership adjustment];

;

;On September 13, 2023, the State Council released information on the appointment and dismissal of national staff, appointing Chen Jiachang as Deputy Minister of Science and Technology, and Hu Weili as Deputy Minister of Justice .

;

;Chen Jiachang was previously the director of the High-tech Department of the Ministry of Science and Technology, and Hu Weilie was previously a member of the Supreme Procuratorate Committee and director of the Eighth Procuratorate.

;

;On September 13, the State Council released information on the appointment and removal of state workers, removing Liu Zhao from the post of deputy minister of the Ministry of Public Security. Liu Zhao was born in Fufeng, Shaanxi Province in December 1963. He once served as the director of the Traffic Management Bureau of the Ministry of Public Security, a member of the Party Committee and Director of the Political Department of the Ministry of Public Security. In July 2020, he was appointed as the Deputy Minister of the Ministry of Public Security.

; On the 13th, the Taiwan Affairs Office of the State Council held a press conference, and the new spokesperson Chen Binhua officially appeared to the media. At the beginning of the meeting, he greeted the reporters present in Mandarin and Hokkien.

;

;The public resume shows that Chen Binhua was born in 1971 and is from Zhao'an, Fujian. Before becoming the spokesperson of the Taiwan Affairs Office of the State Council, he had more than 20 years of experience in media work. From 1993 to 2016, Chen Binhua worked at the Xinhua News Agency Headquarters and was one of the first mainland journalists to station in Taiwan. In April 2016, he was transferred to the Taiwan Affairs Office of the State Council and served successively as deputy director of the Maritime Research Center, deputy director of the Research Bureau, deputy director of the Economic Bureau, and first-level inspector. He currently serves as deputy director and first-level inspector of the Information Bureau of the Taiwan Affairs Office of the State Council.

;

;;[The former host of CCTV Wang Zhiren is the vice president of Minzu University of China];

;

;Recently According to updated information in the "School Leadership" column on the official website of the University for Nationalities of China, Wang Zhi, a former CCTV host, has now become a member of the Standing Committee of the Party Committee and Vice President of the University for Nationalities of China. According to public information, Wang Zhisheng was born in 1965. After graduating from university, he was assigned to Hunan Television and later entered CCTV. He served successively as reporter and host of the "Son of the East" column, reporter and host of "Investigative News", and producer and host of "Face to Face" People, journalists. In October 2008, Wang Zhi took up a temporary position as the deputy mayor of Lijiang City, Yunnan and deputy director of the Information Office of the Yunnan Provincial Government. He was later transferred to the China Red Cross Foundation and served successively as secretary of the party branch of the foundation. In July 2012, Wang Zhi served as assistant to the president of Communication University of China.

;

;;;Anti-Corruption Chronicle; ;

;

;;[ For accepting bribes of more than 325 million yuan, Wang Bin, the former chairman of China Life Insurance Company, was sentenced to suspended death in the first instance];

;

;On September 12, 2023, the Jinan Intermediate People’s Court ruled against the former chairman of China Life Insurance (Group) Company. The case of Party Secretary and Chairman Wang Bin for accepting bribes and concealing overseas deposits was publicly pronounced. Wang Bin was sentenced to death with a two-year suspended sentence, deprived of political rights for life, and confiscated all personal property. Wang Bin was sentenced to death with a two-year suspended sentence. After being commuted to life imprisonment in accordance with the law, he will be sentenced to life imprisonment without the possibility of commutation or parole.

;

;The court found after trial that from 1997 to 2021, Wang Binli served as deputy secretary of the party group and deputy president of the Jiangxi Branch of the Agricultural Development Bank of China, president of the Beijing Branch of the Bank of Communications, and deputy banker of the Bank of Communications. Chairman, Chairman of BoCom International Trust Co., Ltd., Chairman of China Taiping Insurance, Chairman of China Life and Chairman of China Guangfa Bank, etc., directly or indirectly illegally received property equivalent to more than 325 million yuan in total.

;

;;[Five managers of central enterprises accepted review and investigation];

;

;September 14 On the morning of the same day, the Central Commission for Discipline Inspection and the State Supervision Commission issued a notice on the website stating that five managers of central enterprises were under review and investigation. The five people are Sun Honghong, deputy secretary of the Party Committee and general manager of China Energy Construction Group, Zhao Kun, former party secretary and deputy director of Huazhong Optoelectronic Technology Research Institute of China State Shipbuilding Corporation, Xiao Mingde, chairman of the supervisory board of China Grain Reserves Group Finance Co., Ltd., and former deputy director of Sinopec Natural Gas Branch. General Manager Wu Canqi, and Li Zhanping, former secondary business director of Jilin Electric Power Co., Ltd. of the National Energy Group.

;

;;[The director of a judicial office in Shanxi was suspended after his wife reported cheating];

; < p>;On September 13, the Judicial Bureau of Wenxi County, Yuncheng City, Shanxi Province issued a notice stating that after receiving relevant reports, Zhang, the director of the Judicial Office of Yangyu Town within the county's jurisdiction, had been suspended. The incident attracted widespread attention online.

;

;;Ministry and commission information ;

;

;;[Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development: Guarantee this year More than 70% of the task of raising and constructing affordable rental housing has been completed];

;

;On September 12, 2023, the Ministry of Housing and Urban-Rural Development stated that this year, 2.04 million units of affordable rental housing will be raised and constructed nationwide. )’s mission is currently 72% complete. ;

;;

;

;A construction site for prefabricated steel structure affordable housing in Ganzhou, Jiangxi. ;(People's Vision/Picture);

;

;;【二Joint notice from departments requires strengthening the standardized management of large-scale performances];

;

;On September 13, the Ministry of Culture and Tourism and the Ministry of Public Security jointly issued a notice stating that they will further strengthen the regulation of large-scale commercial performances with more than 5,000 people. Standardized management of activities. The notice pointed out that large-scale performance events implement a real-name ticket purchase and admission system. ;

;

;;Rule of Law Report ;

;

;;[Supreme Procuratorate, Ministry of Public Security Initiate the joint listing and supervision of the third batch of five extremely serious cross-border telecommunications network fraud cases];

;

;Recently, the Supreme People’s Procuratorate and the Ministry of Public Security announced that they will jointly supervise the handling of the third batch of five extremely large cross-border telecommunications fraud cases. Internet fraud criminal cases. ;The Supreme People’s Procuratorate said that in the next step, the procuratorial organs will strengthen the accountability for failure to fulfill mandatory reporting obligations through “case-by-case back-investigation” and further tighten the reporting responsibilities of relevant units and personnel.

; >;The Eighth Ministerial Meeting on Cooperation in Combating Crime between the Ministries of Public Security of China and Vietnam was held in Beijing on September 13. ;

;At the meeting, Wang Xiaohong and Su Lin jointly signed a memorandum of understanding on cooperation between China and Vietnam in combating cross-border gambling. Wang Xiaohong mentioned that since the seventh China-Vietnam Ministerial Conference on Cooperation in Combating Crime in 2021, the Ministry of Public Security of China and Vietnam have cooperated successfully in many fields such as chasing fugitives, recovering stolen goods, and combating human trafficking. ;

;;【 There are more than 15,000 technology business incubator institutions in China];

;

;On September 10, 2023, the High-Quality Incubator Development Forum was held in Baoshan, Shanghai. At the meeting, He Defang, deputy secretary-general of the Ministry of Science and Technology, introduced that by the end of 2022, China had more than 15,000 technology business incubator institutions of various types, forming a chain-type technology entrepreneurship service system of nurseries, incubators, accelerators, and technology parks.

;

;He Defang mentioned that in 2022, various incubation institutions across the country will serve nearly 680,000 start-ups and teams, creating more than 5 million jobs. It is reported that technology companies that have emerged from incubators in recent years have accounted for 40% of the total number of hard technology companies on the Science and Technology Innovation Board.

;

;;[Sichuan released 3255 postdoctoral positions, with scientific research funding up to 7 million per year];

;

;Recently, the Sichuan Provincial Department of Human Resources and Social Security released information on postdoctoral recruitment requirements for postdoctoral establishments in Sichuan in 2024. A total of 192 establishments participated, and 3,255 postdoctoral positions were announced. The number of positions increased by 4.7% compared with 2022. %.

;

;Among the recruiting units, key industrial fields account for a large proportion, such as biomedicine, new materials, integrated circuits, artificial intelligence, clinical medicine, biology, materials science and engineering, etc. There is a large demand for talents. The quantity accounts for more than 60%. At the same time, each station unit has launched corresponding policies to attract advantages. The average salary is 250,000-300,000 yuan per year, with a maximum of 800,000 yuan per year, and the maximum scientific research project funding is 7 million yuan per year.

;;[ Temporary residence registration for Taiwan compatriots in Fujian has been cancelled];

;

;According to Xinhua News Agency on September 12, 2023, the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and the State Council issued the "About Supporting Fujian to Explore New Paths for Cross-Strait Integrated Development and Build Cross-Strait Integration" Opinions on the development of demonstration areas. The opinion pointed out that Fujian, as the first home for Taiwanese compatriots and Taiwanese enterprises, will take the lead in canceling the temporary residence registration of Taiwanese compatriots in Fujian, encourage Taiwanese compatriots to apply for Taiwan resident residence certificates, expand the scope of application of Taiwan resident residence certificates for identity verification, and strive to realize the realization of Taiwan residents’ residence permit. The ID card is as convenient for social use as the mainland resident ID card.

;

;;[108 Zhejiang companies were shortlisted for the top 500 private enterprises in China, ranking first in number for 25 consecutive years];< /p>;

;On September 12, the All-China Federation of Industry and Commerce released the "Top 500 Chinese Private Enterprises in 2023" list. A total of 108 Zhejiang companies were shortlisted, ranking first this year. The second, third and fourth places were Jiangsu , Shandong, Guangdong. This is the 25th consecutive year that Zhejiang Province ranks first among all provinces in the country in terms of the number of shortlisted companies.

;

;According to Zhejiang Provincial Industry and Commerce, the total revenue of these 108 Zhejiang shortlisted companies is 8.7 trillion yuan, total assets are 7.94 trillion yuan, and after-tax net profit is 322.3 billion yuan. There are 20 companies in Ningbo, 12 companies in Shaoxing, and 10 companies in Wenzhou, and 83.3% of the companies have increased operating income compared with 2022.

;;[Shandong releases new policy for unannounced inspections of production safety];

;

;Emergency Management Department 9 According to news on March 13, the Shandong Provincial Work Safety Commission recently issued the "Shandong Provincial Production Safety Undercover Inspection System" to clarify the principles, leading units, methods, contents, procedures, requirements, etc. of production safety undercover inspections (hereinafter referred to as unannounced inspections). , making the unannounced inspection system a normalized work measure.

;

;According to the "System", unannounced inspections refer to going straight to the grassroots level and going directly to the scene without giving prior notice, saying hello, listening to reports, accompanying or receiving reception, and conducting surprise inspections, random inspections, and "turning back" See how review works. Undercover inspections are carried out on a regular and irregular basis. In accordance with the principle of combining daily inspections with unannounced inspections, the frequency of unannounced inspections is increased.

;;【国Taiwan Affairs Office spokesperson Chen Binhua: Taiwan is not eligible to join the United Nations];

;

;On September 13, the Taiwan Affairs Office of the State Council held a regular press conference. At the meeting, the new spokesperson Chen Binhua answered reporters’ questions regarding the Taiwan authorities’ recent proposal to urge the United Nations to amend UN General Assembly Resolution 2758. Chen Binhua said that the United Nations is an intergovernmental international organization composed of sovereign states. Taiwan is part of China, not a country, and is not eligible to join the United Nations.

;

;Resolution 2758 was adopted by the 26th United Nations General Assembly in 1971. The resolution decided to restore all legal rights of the People's Republic of China in the United Nations and made it clear that representatives of the government of the People's Republic of China are China's only legal representatives in the United Nations, so that there will be no problems of "two Chinas" and "one China, one Taiwan."

;

;Recently, I had a dinner with several fellow villagers. A physical education teacher who works in a primary school in Guangzhou expressed his difficulties to me. He works diligently and conscientiously. More than 20 years have passed, but he still cannot be awarded a senior professional title because he has no skills in paper writing and has never published a scientific research paper.

;

;The experience of fellow students is not unique. Many primary and secondary school teachers, especially older teachers, were turned away during the professional title review process because they did not complete the basic requirements for writing scientific research papers, regardless of their teaching years. How long it has been, how rich the teaching experience is, and how many outstanding students it has trained.

;

;A journal editor friend of mine told me that her professional title evaluation was based on the editing sequence, but the evaluation indicators were basically the same as those of scientific researchers. In other words, the relevant parties' performance evaluation is based on the same as that of a full-time scientific researcher.

;

;Similar to the experiences of teachers, there are doctors and people in other fields. For example, doctors also have basic requirements for scientific research papers or scientific research projects during the professional title evaluation process. They are busy treating diseases and saving people, and have no time to write papers, or are unable to complete papers. When the time comes for professional title evaluation, they are often at a loss.

;

;An agricultural expert may have rich practical experience in agriculture. After years of exploration and practice, he and his team have cultivated improved seeds, greatly increased grain output, and significantly increased grain productivity. He has trained many outstanding talents, but perhaps he still has an intermediate professional title simply because he is old and does not have or is not good at writing and publishing papers.

;

;Obviously, writing papers and applying for projects have become prerequisites for the evaluation of professional titles for most professional and technical personnel. Without a paper of a certain weight and a project of a certain level, you cannot be promoted to a professional title.

;

;There are several basic problems here.

;

;First, papers and projects have become the most important factors in the assessment and evaluation mechanism of practitioners in many industries. Is this reasonable?

;

;Common sense tells us that a teacher’s primary duty is to teach and educate people so that students can grow and thrive healthily; a doctor’s primary duty is to treat illnesses and save lives, and relieve patients from their illnesses. Compared with publishing papers or applying for projects, teaching or saving people are the most important things for teachers or doctors. It is really difficult and unnecessary to ask every teacher to be good at doing scientific research and writing papers, to ask every doctor to be good at doing scientific research and writing papers, and to ask every agricultural expert to write papers and submit projects. In other words, if you put the importance of writing papers and applying for projects above teaching, saving people, and taking root in the field, you are literally putting the cart before the horse.

;

;Second, since papers and topics should not be the most important indicators, why are they most frequently adopted in various personnel assessment and evaluation mechanisms? This is mainly due to the advantages of quantification. Generally speaking, for the assessment of a person, quantitative indicators are generally better than qualitative indicators. The former can eliminate subjective factors such as favors or relationships to a certain extent, that is, by counting the number of published papers, the level of journals, the level of applied topics and Funding is used to determine a person's professional level. As the main basis for professional title evaluation, it is relatively fair and fair, and it is relatively simple to operate.

;

;Thirdly, are published papers or successfully applied topics necessarily very good? Can it truly reflect the scientific research ability or professional level of the person concerned? Not really. Many teachers are busy with daily teaching, or are not familiar with the routine of writing papers due to their old age. Many doctors are busy with heavy work and have no time to write papers. What should I do? Some people can only temporarily hire gunmen to write their papers and buy space to publish them. There are even “paper processing factories” and “paper gunmen” emerging one after another.

;

;The result is that fake and shoddy papers are flying all over the place. Even if many papers are published, the authors themselves are too lazy to pay attention to them, and either shelve them or abandon them. Many papers are completed behind closed doors in the office, that is, mainly by purchasing data, constructing models, copying and pasting, and revising and revising. As for the relationship between the theoretical contribution of the paper and its practical value, and the relationship between the paper and one's own field of expertise, it is not important. What is important is that the article has been put into print.

;

;In the same way, the funds applied for for many projects are not small, ranging from several million to tens of millions, but they are of little help in solving major issues in China's comprehensive modernization process, and they are not very helpful in promoting this discipline. There are very few major theoretical innovation contributions in the field.

;

;Fourth, what is a good paper or a good topic? Yu believes that a good topic or paper must originate from real production and life practices, must be combined with real production and life practices, and must undergo careful and rigorous exploration, investigation and research, or fill a certain research field. The blanks will either play a positive role in promoting human understanding and revealing the truth.

;

;Of course qualified teachers are encouraged to write papers, but the direct or main purpose of writing papers is to improve the quality of teaching, not to complete requirements, let alone write empty and irrelevant articles that have nothing to do with their own teaching. Boring garbage article. As a teacher, the topic or focus of the paper or topic should mainly focus on teaching, such as the discussion of teaching methods, the improvement of teaching forms, the summary of teaching experience, the design of teaching models, etc. As a doctor, the topic or focus of his paper or project should mainly originate from or be inspired by his own medical treatment process. The paper or project should be conducive to the fundamental alleviation or solution of a difficult and complicated disease and contribute to the practical improvement of medical treatment. It plays a practical role in improving patient treatment efficiency and fundamentally improving human health conditions.

;

;Relevant parties need to re-examine and seriously reflect on the concrete meaning of the four words "people-oriented": schools are places to cultivate talents, "people-oriented" should be student-oriented, and teachers' primary responsibility is to make students healthy Growth and vigorous development; the hospital is a place where diseases are treated and patients are saved. "Humanism" is based on the patient, and the doctor's primary responsibility is to relieve the patient's pain.

;

;For the assessment and evaluation of relevant practitioners, the overall principle is to allow most people to return to their main business or first business, give full play to their strengths, and fundamentally change or optimize the current KPI assessment system in all walks of life. inappropriate or unreasonable elements, moderately or significantly reduce the proportion of papers or topics; implement different assessment methods and details for different types of practitioners, including paper or topic assessments and practical ability assessments, rather than the current relative The prevailing one-way street of only essays or only topics.

;
